archdesc.runner: Digital Library and Archive, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Digital Library and Archive, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University
did.abstract: Collection contains letters to the editor received by Lucy Minogue when she was news editor and editor-in-chief of The Virginia Techin 1968-69. Also included are other correspondence she received during the same time, editorial copy, and the paper's masthead.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Permission to publish material from the Lucy Minogue Rowland Papers must be obtained from the Digital Library and Archives, Virginia Tech.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Lucy Minogue Rowland Papers, Ms2003-024, Digital Library and Archives, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Information
bioghist.p: Lucy Minogue (Rowland) was a member of the class of 1969 at Virginia Polytechnic Institute. She was first news editor and then editor-in-chief of the student newspaper The Virginia Techin 1968-69. She earned a B.S. in biology/zoology (1969) and a M.S. in microbiology (1972) at Virginia Tech, and later earned a Masters in Library Science at the University of Maryland.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: Scope is 1968-69. Topics of the letters to the editor include alcoholic beverages, women at VPI, VPI name change, and removing the Confederate flag from the Coliseum. Also included are letters of a political nature including a signed letter from David Eisenhower on "Youth for Nixon-Agnew," correspondence with Senator William B. Spong, Jr., and letters congratulating Minogue on her appointment as editor-in-chief.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged chronologically. Note that letters to the paper initialed by Lucy Minogue were published. Those marked "NP" were not published.

did.unittitle: Letters to the editor of The Virginia Tech, November, 1968 to March, 1969
Undated letters to the editor c. 1968-69

Copy for editorial endorsing Tom Sanders, editor of Alice, an alternative publication, and copies of The Virginia Techmasthead.
